title: President ‘Perception’
sub_head: Sometimes survival requires more than public relations.
body:
Historians may spend years trying to understand how President Joe Biden could have so mismanaged the exit from Afghanistan. A new report suggests the career politician was focused on appearances rather than reality.
Reuters has published what it calls excerpts from a July phone call between President Joe Biden and Afghanistan President Ashraf Ghani. According to the Reuters transcript, Mr. Biden said:
What good did it do to present a false picture of success as the Taliban marched toward Kabul? Mr. Biden was publicly presenting such a false picture in July and it seems to have served only to deceive American civilians and our Afghan allies into thinking they had more time before they had to flee.
Of course what they really needed was a defense against the Taliban, but even when addressing military matters, our commander-in-chief couldn’t seem to stay focused on reality. The Reuters transcript continues:
According to the transcript Mr. Biden then made promises of support which he has not kept, and then was back to his favorite subject:
